content.description: Fun, juggy, long, and steep for the grade.  Five star climbing and one star descent.  Bolts, slings and leaver biners at the summit anchor as of 8/17 but no chains or rings.  We rapped off the other side at the top (mistake!) and rapped into thick forrest.  Yikes.  Better option, it seems, is to rap straight back down the face.  Issue here, though, is ropes getting hung during retrieval.
content.protection: Knob slings, gear to 3", optional doubles on 2-3".
content.location: Start on Runnel Lust and traverse right across the face.  Aim for arete up high, and the summit.

content.description: Start on some steep moderate jugs. Don't get cocky, the real climbing begins above. Move through the first crux, then onto an easy slab bit for a couple of blots before launching onto the vertical technical face above. Move past two more cruxes before clipping the chains. Sustained, technical and a classic! Doesn't let up until the very end. This route is RAD!
content.location: Bolted route beside Runnel Vision (Obvious steep black runnel). The first bolt is high, but easy to clip.

content.description: Follow the super crazy deep, beautiful, black runnel up to the anchor. Climbing on plates, slinging knobs and staying just off to the right of this main runnel.
content.protection: Chicken heads all the way up, optional gear to 2" that you won't use. 2 bolt anchor w/rap rings (look left once about 30m up)
content.location:
Around the corner on the east face of runnel vision wall, spot the deep runnel going up it. Start a little to the right above a short little boulder cliff and hop on!

Stay on the climber's trail till here 37.33548, -119.40881. From here you should be able to see the wall to your left.
